definition: to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: Just where do the politics of IT workers lie?
sentences.chinese: 政治职业IT工作者的谎言来自何处？

sentences.english: We know it was written by a guy named John.
sentences.chinese: 我们知道它的作者是一个名叫约翰的人。

sentences.english: What is more, the author also tries to construct the senior chemistry teaching model of developing autonomous learning.
sentences.chinese: 作者还尝试构建了高中化学自主探究教学模式。

sentences.english: And to accept that - to quote him - "it shoots, it hits".
sentences.chinese: 引用作者的话，便是，箭在射，箭打中了靶心。

sentences.english: Besides copyright, the writer got a 10-percent royalty on sales.
sentences.chinese: 除拥有版权外，作者得到百分之十的版税。

sentences.english: The image of youth comes from the artist's self-reflection and expression of emotion.
sentences.chinese: 少年的形象是出于作者对自我情绪的反思和表达。

sentences.english: A biological worker always makes it a point to record the time when a specimen in collected .
sentences.chinese: 生物工作者必定记下采得标本的时间。

sentences.english: His latest biographer, Mr. More, has been more candid.
sentences.chinese: 他最近的传记作者，莫尔先生则较为坦诚一些。

sentences.english: As such this contribution is rather a blatant example of ego-tripping and questionable self-promotion on the part of the author.
sentences.chinese: 所以，这看起来更像是作者的自吹自擂和自我宣传。

sentences.english: The author pulldown is a little bit more complicated.
sentences.chinese: 作者下拉列表稍微复杂一些。

sentences.english: Gordon G. Chang is the author of The Coming Collapse of China.
sentences.chinese: 章家敦是《中国即将崩溃》一书的作者。

sentences.english: The authors suggest that the Chencai Group is one of the possible source bed for uranium deposits formed.
sentences.chinese: 作者认为，陈蔡群是形成铀矿床的可能铀源层之一。

sentences.english: The authors are eminently qualified to explore the topic.
sentences.chinese: 这两位作者非常有资格探讨这一主题。

sentences.english: Boswell was the biographer of dr johnson.
sentences.chinese: 鲍斯威尔是詹森博士的传记作者。

sentences.english: After the writer's death, reading his journal is like receiving a long letter.
sentences.chinese: 在作者死亡之后，阅读他的日志就想收到了一封长信。

sentences.english: For example, many medical workers are convinced that the number of emergency cases increases during a full moon.
sentences.chinese: 例如，许多医务工作者相信月圆时急诊病例会增多。

definition: this text/article/the main body of a book
source (esp. of quotation or literary allusion)/origin/where sth comes from
piece of writing submitted for publication/manuscript/article
to forward (a shipment)/to reprint sth published elsewhere/Taiwan pr. [zhuan3 zai4]
to submit articles for publication/to contribute (writing)
